ra_ref.title: Right Ascension of the reference point (deg)
ra_ref.description: Right Ascension of the reference point (deg)

roll_ref.title: Telescope roll angle of V3 North over East at the ref. point (deg)
roll_ref.description: Telescope roll angle of V3 North over East at the ref. point (deg)

velosys.title: [m/s] Radial velocity wrt Barycenter
velosys.description: The radial velocity of JWST with respect to the Barycenter, in units of m/sec. Computed as the dot product of the total velocity of JWST relative to the barycenter in the direction of RA_REF/DEC_REF. The total JWST velocity is the sum of the JWST velocity relative to Earth and the velocity of Earth relative to the barycenter.
velosys.mode: MIR_MRS, MIR_LRS-FIXEDSLIT, MIR_LRS-SLITLESS, NRC_WFSS, NRS_MSASPEC, NRS_FIXEDSLIT, NRS_IFU, NIS_WFSS, NIS_SOSS

specsys.title: Spectral reference frame
specsys.description: The reference frame in use for spectroscopic coordinate axes.  For JWST data this Barycentric.
specsys.mode: MIR_MRS, MIR_LRS-FIXEDSLIT, MIR_LRS-SLITLESS, NRC_WFSS, NRS_MSASPEC, NRS_FIXEDSLIT, NRS_IFU, NIS_WFSS, NIS_SOSS

dispersion_direction.title: Dispersion direction
dispersion_direction.description: The DISPAXIS keyword indicates the orientation of dispersed spectra in spectroscopic exposures. A value of 1 indicates that the dispersion is parallel to the X image axis (horizontal) and 2 indicates the Y image axis (vertical).
dispersion_direction.mode: MIR_MRS, MIR_LRS-FIXEDSLIT, MIR_LRS-SLITLESS, NRC_WFSS, NRC_TSGRISM, NIS_SOSS, NIS_WFSS, NRS_FIXEDSLIT, NRS_IFU, NRS_MSASPEC, NRS_BRIGHTOBJ

siaf_xref_sci.title: Aperture X reference point in SCI frame
siaf_xref_sci.description: The aperture X reference point in the science frame, retrieved from the SIAF entry "XSciRef" for the aperture in use. Gives the location of the target in floating-point image pixel values for NIRCam TSO grism exposures.

siaf_yref_sci.title: Aperture Y reference point in SCI frame
siaf_yref_sci.description: The aperture Y reference point in the science frame, retrieved from the SIAF entry "YSciRef" for the aperture in use. Gives the location of the target in floating-point image pixel values for NIRCam TSO grism exposures.

mt_ra.title: [deg] Moving target RA at exposure mid-point
mt_ra.description: MT_RA is the right ascension of the moving target at the mid-point of the exposure, which is computed by interpolating within the target position values given in the Moving Target Position table extension.

mt_dec.title: [deg] Moving target Dec at exposure mid-point
mt_dec.description: MT_DEC is the declination of the moving target at the mid-point of the exposure, which is computed by interpolating within the target position values given in the Moving Target Position table extension.

mt_avra.title: [deg] Moving target average RA over exposures
mt_avra.description: MT_AVRA gives the right ascension of a moving target averaged over all exposures within an observation. It is the simple mean of the MT_RA values in each exposure. The average position is used to compute an appropriate WCS offset for each exposure so that the target is properly aligned when creating combined images/spectra.

mt_avdec.title: [deg] Moving target average DEC over exposures
mt_avdec.description: MT_AVDEC gives the declination of a moving target averaged over all exposures within an observation. It is the simple mean of the MT_DEC values in each exposure. The average position is used to compute an appropriate WCS offset for each exposure so that the target is properly aligned when creating combined images/spectra.
